```{r}
library(sf)
library(leaflet)
library(dplyr)

# Define the path to the shapefile
shapefile_path <- "C:/Users/mutaalf/Desktop/DOD Code/States_shapefile-shp/States_shapefile.shp"

# Read the shapefile
states <- st_read(shapefile_path)
print("Shapefile read successfully")
print(str(states))  # Print structure of the spatial data

# Rename the State_Name column in the spatial data to State
states <- states %>% rename(State = State_Name)

# Convert the State variable to uppercase in the year.state.DOD dataset
year.state.DOD <- year.state.DOD %>%
  mutate(State = toupper(State))

# Assuming 'year.state.DOD' is already loaded in your environment
year.state.DOD_1822 <- year.state.DOD %>%
  group_by(State) %>%
  summarise(
    Total_Deaths = sum(Deaths),
    Total_Population = sum(Population),
    DOD_death_rate = (Total_Deaths / Total_Population) * 100000,  # DOD rate per 100,000 population
    .groups = "drop"  # Optional: drop the grouping once summarisation is done
  ) %>%
  na.omit()

print("Summarized data:")
print(str(year.state.DOD_1822))  # Print structure of the summarized data

# Merge the summarized data with the spatial data
states_merged <- merge(states, year.state.DOD_1822, by = "State")
print("Merged data:")
print(str(states_merged))  # Print structure of the merged data

# Check if merged data contains any geometries
print(st_geometry(states_merged))

mybins <- c(60, 80, 100, 120, 140, 160)

# Define the color palette for the death rate
pal <- colorBin(
  palette = "viridis",
  domain = states_merged$DOD_death_rate,
  bins = mybins
)

# Create the leaflet map
map <- leaflet(states_merged) %>%
  addTiles() %>%
  addPolygons(
    fillColor = ~pal(DOD_death_rate),
    fillOpacity = 0.7,
    color = "white",
    weight = 1,
    popup = ~paste("State:", State, "<br>Death rate:", DOD_death_rate)
  ) %>%
  addLegend(
    pal = pal,
    values = ~DOD_death_rate,
    opacity = 0.7,
    title = "U.S. Average DOD Rates per 100,000 people (2018-2022)<br><span style='font-size:10px; color: black;'>Data obtained from the National Center for Health Statistics (CDC)</span>",
    position = "bottomleft"
  )

# Display the map
map
```
